title: Conductive Supports
fullText:
Conductive supports for overhead lines or cables shall be earthed where they are—
• (a) located in an earthed situation; or
• (b) electrically continuous with an extraneous conductive part that is located in an earthed situation.

Exception: Conductive supports need not be earthed if—
• (i) they support only cables having double insulation; or
• (ii) they support only cables operating at extra-low voltage; or
• (iii) they support only cables supplied by a separated extra-low voltage system.
